Definition.Document:
Vibration Analysis

Objective

Vibration analysis, applied in an industrial or maintenance environment aims to reduce maintenance costs and equipment downtime by detecting equipment faults.

Steps to Calculate

1. Raw signals for DE_X & DE_Y

2. Raw signals for NDE_X & NDE_Y

3. Cleanse  DE_X & DE_Y

$a.lowPassFilter(15min, 1s)

4. Cleanse NDE_X & NDE_Y

5. Define OEM limit.

6.Define ISO10816 Limit according to machine datasheet.

7.Define Alert for DE_x.   

$deviation1 = $input - $boundary1$results1 = valueSearch($deviation1, 250h, isGreaterThan(0), 0min, true, isLessThan(0), 0min, true)$results1

8.Define Alert for DE_y

9.Define Alert for NDE_x

10.Define Alert for NDE_y

11.Perform Phase comparison for DE_x and DE_y (>30Deg)- No Data 

12.Perform Phase comparison for DE_x and DE_y (>30Deg)-No Data

12.Validate spectrum analysis to identify forcing frequencies present in the waveform.- No Data

Note

Kindly refer comment delimiter adjacent OEM and ISO10816 Limits.

Vibration Analysis

Objective

Vibration analysis, applied in an industrial or maintenance environment aims to reduce maintenance costs and equipment downtime by detecting equipment faults.

Steps to Calculate

1. Raw signals for DE_X & DE_Y

2. Raw signals for NDE_X & NDE_Y

3. Cleanse  DE_X & DE_Y

Formula
$a.lowPassFilter(15min, 1s)
4. Cleanse NDE_X & NDE_Y
5. Define OEM limit.
6.Define ISO10816 Limit according to machine datasheet.
7.Define Alert for DE_x.   
8.Define Alert for DE_y
9.Define Alert for NDE_x
10.Define Alert for NDE_y
11.Perform Phase comparison for DE_x and DE_y (>30Deg)- No Data 
12.Perform Phase comparison for DE_x and DE_y (>30Deg)-No Data
12.Validate spectrum analysis to identify forcing frequencies present in the waveform.- No Data
Note
Kindly refer comment delimiter adjacent OEM and ISO10816 Limits.
